parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the instrument cluster can cause the displays for gear, temperature, and time to become inoperable, leading to potential safety issues, such as incorrect gear selection, and inconvenience to the driver.
symptoms: and time are not visible or have missing pixels
clock and gear selection indicator failure

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the electrical system can cause various components to malfunction, leading to safety issues, such as loss of power steering and brakes, and inconvenience to the driver.
symptoms: and brake lamps going out frequently
passenger side bulb housing melting away
electrical issues causing the car to stall.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Water Ingress and Electrical System Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Water ingress into the electrical system can cause various components to malfunction, leading to safety issues, such as loss of power windows and mirrors, and inconvenience to the driver.
symptoms: rear windows no longer working from front switches

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the crank position sensor can cause the engine to stall, leading to potential safety issues and inconvenience to the driver.
symptoms: car not starting for several minutes.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Faulty Cam and Crankshaft Position Sensor
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The faulty sensor can cause the engine to die or stall, leading to a loss of vehicle control and increasing the risk of accidents.
The failure of the engine mount can cause the engine to rotate excessively, leading to damage to surrounding components and potentially causing loss of vehicle control.
The failure of the engine control module can cause a loss of all vehicle power, leading to a sudden engine stall and increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: and inability to restart the engine.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The faulty catalytic converters can cause a severe loss of power, leading to a loss of vehicle control and increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: Severe loss of power during operation.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The engine stalling can cause a loss of vehicle control, increasing the risk of accidents.
The failure of the serpentine belt can cause a loss of power steering, leading to a loss of vehicle control and increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: Serpentine belt melting and falling off
and failure of other components such as the A/C compressor.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Premature Rust and Corrosion on Mercedes-Benz W210 (1997-2002) Models
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The premature rust and corrosion on Mercedes-Benz W210 models can lead to structural failures, compromising the safety and integrity of the vehicle, potentially causing accidents or injuries.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Failure of Front Subframe and Upper Control Arm due to Rust and Corrosion
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the front subframe and upper control arm can cause loss of steering, loud scraping noises, and potentially lead to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: and rusted upper control arm components.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Inadequate Rust Protection and Warranty Coverage
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The inadequate rust protection and warranty coverage can leave vehicle owners with costly repairs and potentially compromise their safety on the road.
symptoms: lack of assistance from the manufacturer
